config.question: How did the non-slaveholding farmers come to depend on the blacks?

choices.content: The degraded status of the blacks made them feel good about themselves.
Black preachers were the main source of education for the farmers.
The free slaves assisted these farmers in times of trouble.
The culture of the slaves was similar to that of the yeomen farmers.

answer_3.response: The non-slaveholding yeoman farmers or artisans depended on slavery psychologically, because having a degraded class of blacks below them made them feel better about their own place in the society.
